Subject: Re: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero status code? ( junit & ant problem)
In-Reply-To: <8FEAF245D32AD1119BC10060B06895E508D210E7@...>
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.21.0102021505240.9439-100000@...>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
From: Joi Ellis <joi@...>

On Fri, 2 Feb 2001 perry.tew@... wrote:

> Hello.  I'm learning junit, and I'm working through one of the tutorials
> listed on junit.org titled "Incremental development with Ant and JUnit".
> The problem I'm having is that when I run ant, my junit reports an error,
> but ant reports an overall success.  If I add a System.exit(1) to the end of
> my main method in my Test program, ant reports a FAILURE.  I'm following the
> tutorial as it's written, but I can't seem to make ant fail when junit does.
> Would someone please look at my build.xml (trimmed), junit code, and my
> output and see if I'm making a mistake somewhere?
 
I don't know if this is the problem you're having, but there is an open
issue on Sun's Bug Parade about System.exit() not passing its parameter
back to the platform.  At all.  It's been causing lots of problems for
people calling 1.3's javac from makefiles.

  http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4388732.html

Apparently this is a glibc issue most often seen on Red Hat 7.0.

  http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23758


Perhaps one of these issues is causing your Ant/Junit combination a
similar headache.
-- 
Joi Ellis                    Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies          joi@..., gyles19@...

subject: Re: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero status code? ( junit & ant problem)
